content:
Diagnosis:		Metastatic small cell carcinoma of prostate

Management:		Completed 6 cycles carboplatin/etoposide March-July 2023
		Palliative radiotherapy to T7-T9 August 2023
		Second-line topotecan commenced September 2023

Histology:		Small cell neuroendocrine carcinoma, Ki67 80%
		PSA 0.8, Chromogranin A 380 (elevated)

Current Situation:	Disease progression on topotecan

I reviewed [redacted name] today in the urgent assessment clinic. Unfortunately his recent CT shows clear disease progression with growth of liver metastases (largest lesion increased from 3.2cm to 4.8cm) and new pulmonary nodules. His bone metastases appear stable post-radiotherapy but he reports increasing pain in his right hip requiring escalation of analgesia. His performance status has declined to ECOG 3, spending >50% of time in bed. He has developed significant fatigue, anorexia with 6kg weight loss over 6 weeks, and new onset right upper quadrant pain. Blood tests show deteriorating liver function with bilirubin 45, ALT 156.

Given his declining performance status and clear disease progression, we have discussed stopping topotecan. He understands the poor prognosis at this stage. I have referred urgently to palliative care and arranged weekly supportive care review. We will continue current morphine (Zomorph 30mg BD) but increase breakthrough oxycodone to 5mg PRN. CT head arranged for next week given new intermittent headaches. Will review with results in supportive care clinic next week.
